intro: Piper subcinereum var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaf pepper plant, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces tiny, pale green to yellowish flowers that develop into small, round berries. It is valued for its aromatic leaves used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The varietal name "parvifolium" refers to its small foliage, distinguishing it from other varieties of Piper subcinereum.
